Section 1 Section 2 1. Relating multiplication to addition ‚ûú 2 x 2 is the same as 2 + 2
\nor
\n‚ûú 3 x 4 is the same as 4 + 4 + 4
This section covers the basic stuff üòé This section will get you started with multiplication ü•∞ The section will show you some awesome tricks! ü§ì
Section 1: Basics 2. Start with the multiples of zero and one
Adding zero to a number has no effect on its identity:
\n‚ûú n + 0 = n
\nin multiplication, any number multiplied by zero is also zero:
\n‚ûú n x 0 = 0
\n0 is a void!
\n
\nMultiplying by one (The identity property):
\nIn short, the identity property states that the product of a given number and one is that number itself:
\n‚ûú n x 1 = n
\n
\nMultiplying a number by one results in the same value. Let\'s say, one x 10 apples results to 10 apples. 1 is a mirror!
Section 3 Section 4 Section 2: Getting Started 8 groups of 2 = 16 8 x 2 The commutative property Just like addition, multiplication is commutative, meaning the order of factors doesn\'t change the product (the answer).
\n
\nIn other words, two numbers can be multiplied in any order, and the product will be the same. For example, multiplying 8 x 2 will give you the same answer as multiplying 2 x 8.
2 groups of 8 = 16 Rotate the array Section 3: Techniques 1. The associative property The rule of associative property states that no matter the way you group factors, the product will always be the same.
\n
\nFor example,
\n‚ûú (a x b) x c = a x (b x c)
\nor
\n‚ûú (1 x 2) x 3 = 1 x (2 x 3)
2. The distributive property The distributive property is symbolized as:
\n‚ûú a(b + c) = (ab) + (ac)
\n
\nPut simply, the property spreads out ‚Äî or, as its name implies, distributes ‚Äî the value of a equally to b and c.
\n
\nFor example,
\nfor 6 x 8, they may use the distributive property to think:
\n‚ûú (6 x 5) + (6 x 3), or 30 + 18

Help
\n 1. How can i get a mathematical training?
\n 1.1 Push the button "LEARN".
\n 1.2 Choose between the 3 sections or the TABLE section sliding right or left!!
\n 2. How can i start a test?
\n 2.1 You can start a test pushing the button "START TEST" from the main menu.
\n 2.2 You can start a test pushing the button "TABLES" from the main menu and select the multiplications table you want to exercise.
\n 3. How can i see my profile details?
\n 3.1 You can see your profile details by pressing the button with the human figure from the main menu.
\n 4. How can i edit my name?
\n 4.1 You can edit your name by pressing the button with the human figure from the main menu.
\n 4.2 Then push the button with the pencil on it which is located in the top right corner.
\n 4.3 Write the name you want in the brackets and click the button "SAVE".
\n 5. How can i log out?
\n 5.1 You can log out from the profile page by pressing the button with the human figure from the main menu and then press the button "LOGOUT".
\n 6. How can i see my progress?
\n 6.1 You can see your progress by pressing the button "HISTORY"
\n 6.2 You can sort your progress by date pressing the button which is located in the top right corner and select the option "DATE ADDED"
\n 6.3 You can sort your progress by type pressing the button which is located in the top right corner and select the option "TYPE"
